      static java.lang.String EXITS_MARKER
      Beginning of the Exit Section of the file (.bork) being read
      (package private) static java.lang.String FILENAME_LEADER
      tells the file (.sav) which Dungeon file (.bork) to read to re-construct the dungeon
      static java.lang.String ITEMS_MARKER
      Beginning of the Item Section of the file (.bork) being read
      (package private) static java.lang.String ROOM_STATES_MARKER
      beginning of the section in the file (.sav) that changes the stateof rooms like whether it has been visited and what items are currently in it.
      static java.lang.String ROOMS_MARKER
      Beginning of the Room Section of the file (.bork) being read
      static java.lang.String SECOND_LEVEL_DELIM
      part of file being read that inicates the end of one class and the beginning of another class of the same type like from Room to Room
      static java.lang.String TOP_LEVEL_DELIM
      part of file that indictes the transition from one section to be parsed to another like from Room to Exit

    • Constructor Detail

      • Dungeon

        public Dungeon(java.lang.String filename)
        throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
               Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException
        Read from the .bork filename passed, and instantiate a Dungeon object based on it.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file being used
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if there isn't a file to be found, ya dingus
        Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException - if the file being read was constructed incorrectly

      • Dungeon

        public Dungeon(java.lang.String filename,
               boolean initState)
        throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
               Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException
        Read from the .bork filename passed, and instantiate a Dungeon object based on it, including (possibly) the items in their original locations.
        Parameters:
        filename - String of the File being read
        initState - boolean used to instantiate the Dungeon
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if there isnt a file to be read, you cannot play the game
        Dungeon.IllegalDungeonFormatException - if the file being read has been constructed incorrectly

      • Dungeon

        Dungeon(java.lang.String name,
        Room entry)
        constructor for Dungeon Class
        Parameters:
        name - String to be used as Dungeon's name
        entry - Room used as the start of the dungeon from which the rest of the dungeon will be built around

        public void add(Item item)
        Adds an Item to the Dungeon's items Hashtable called in the construction of the Dungeon

        item - Item being added to items Hashtable

        public void add(Room room)
        adds a room to a the Dungeon's rooms Hashtable called in the construction of the Dungeon
        Parameters:
        room - Room being added to rooms HashTable

      • getEntry

        public Room getEntry()
        gets the entry room of the dungeon, the "seed" from which the rest of the dungeon is built
        Returns:
        The dungeon's entrance

      • getItem

        public Item getItem(java.lang.String primaryItemName)
             throws Item.NoItemException
        Get the Item object whose primary name is passed. This has nothing to do with where the Adventurer might be, or what's in his/her inventory, etc.
        Throws:
        Item.NoItemException

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the Dungeon
        Returns:
        The name of the Dungeon

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • restoreState

        void restoreState(java.util.Scanner s)
           throws GameState.IllegalSaveFormatException
        Restore the (changeable) state of this dungeon to that reflected in the reader passed.
        Parameters:
        s - Scanner object being used to scan the ".sav" file being used to "load" a game
        Throws:
        GameState.IllegalSaveFormatException - if the ".sav" file is constructed incorrectly

      • storeState

        void storeState(java.io.PrintWriter w)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Store the current (changeable) state of this dungeon to the writer passed.
        Parameters:
        w - Printwriter that will write to the .sav file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
